docs.text: do the folks at disney have no common decency ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they have resurrected yet another cartoon and turned it into a live action hodgepodge of expensive special effects , embarrassing writing and kid-friendly slapstick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wasn't mr . magoo enough , people ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: obviously not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: inspector gadget is not what i would call ideal family entertainment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: younger viewers will likely be taken in by the abounding goofiness , but their adult companions may feel a wave of nausea sweeping over them as they attempt to endure this appalling 80-minute exercise in glaring stupidity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie is poorly edited , grossly manipulative , and the finished product resembles somewhat of a failed jigsaw puzzle .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all the elements are there , but the manner in which director david kellogg pieces them together is laughable and trite .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a huge fan of the 80's animated tv show , the first thing i must express is my anger toward the treatment of the main villain .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the cartoon , dr . claw was a frightening , raspy-voiced presence who remained a total mystery to the viewer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we never saw his face ; he simply sat back in his arm-chair , watching surveillance cameras and gently stroking his loyal cat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a child , i always imagined what dr . claw would appear as - and this curiosity kept me watching for many years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the release of the live-action movie , the face of this once intriguing villain has been unrightfully exposed - it's . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rupert everett ? !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only now , dr . claw is simply known as claw ( `one word , ' he explains , `like madonna' ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he sports a shiny clamp instead of the steel glove , and seems far less interesting than the animated version .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it helps that the dashing everett is enthusiastic , but he overplays the role entirely too far .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when all is said and done , this wasn't a very wise move on the part of the screenwriters - the infamous dr . claw has been turned into a wisecracking game show host who makes cheap attempts at being suave and cool .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he does still have his cat , though .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the title role , matthew broderick looks lost .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actor , while usually downright charming , doesn't know exactly where to take his character - a fault that again can be blamed on the hapless writers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: broderick first plays a friendly , naive security guard named john brown , who dreams of becoming a cop and upholding the law for the good of the people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he has a mad crush on pretty scientist brenda ( joely fisher ) , who has stumbled upon a new wave of technology involving the interaction of human tissue and electronics .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but one fateful night , her lab is destroyed and her experiment is stolen by a fiendish millionaire ( everett ) who wants to take over the world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: john courageously pursues the limousine from the scene of the crime , but loses the chase when his vehicle bursts into flames .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in a full body cast , he is chosen to be the first human prototype for brenda's work ; a revolutionary crime fighting tool with numerous fancy gadgets to dispatch bad guys .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and so is born inspector gadget .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as bad as this movie is , it does have a certain charm in isolated scenes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: broderick actually fares better playing robo gadget , an evil and destructive clone that claw has set loose on the city .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and there are about two or three amusing punch lines , the funniest being when robo gadget impersonates a rampaging monster with shadow puppets on a brick wall , and a japanese man flees the scene while screaming , `this is why i left tokyo ! '
docs.label: negative

docs.text: alas , the hit ratio of the ongoing gags is about 20 to 1 in favor of not even cracking a slight giggle .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are so many tired plot additions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: gadget's talking car ( voiced by d . l .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hughley ) is the same type of character as zoot the suit from my favorite martian .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both are wisecracking , non-human additions designed to coax laughter from smaller children .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , it just doesn't work ( in fact , zoot functioned marvelously in comparison to this ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and don't even get me started about the villains .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i didn't mind everett's performance , but his bumbling assistants will make every adult cringe with disgust .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters from the cartoon have been reduced to thankless supporting roles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: penny ( michelle trachtenberg ) and brain the dog now have little to do with the action , and chief quimby ( dabney coleman ) has lost considerable appeal in the transition of animation to live action .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the special effects are everywhere , but not so annoying they will cause your eyes to peel over .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the problem here lies solely in the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps the next time disney attempts a remake like this , they will invest more in the screenplay than the fancy-schmancy visuals .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here is one critic crossing his fingers , anyway .
docs.label: negative
